lines.text: Heat flows from warmer interior to cooler refrigerant
Work causes heat flow from warm to cold
Work moves heat from colder to warmer location

secText:
Lesson:
1. Define [OBJ:expsec_l059:engines].
2. Define [OBJ:expsec_l060:heat engines].
3. Calculate the amount of [OBJ:expsec_l061:work done by an engine].
4. Determine the [OBJ:expsec_l058:signs] used in the first law of thermodynamics when heat is transferred in or out of a system, or when the system does work or work is done by the system.
5. Work through a sample problem to [OBJ:app_calc_heat_out_force_question:calculate the heat flow] during an engine's cycle.
6. Apply the concepts of heat engines to [OBJ:expsec_l077:refrigerators].
7. Apply the concepts of heat engines to [OBJ:expsec_l078:heat pumps].

In-class assessment:
1. [OBJ:qc_37375:Calculate] the net work done by an engine.
